replies.bodyText:
Is Gradle necessary? I'm not particularly excited to have to maintain and test everything with two different build systems.
And I'm sure QE wouldn't be either.
replies.author: triceo

replies.bodyText:
20% of the java ecosystem use Gradle.
We can't keep ignoring them I think. Definitly worth a discussion.
replies.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.author: ge0ffrey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,129 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+    <groupId>org.optaplanner.quickstarts</groupId>
+    <artifactId>optaplanner-spring-boot-school-timetabling-quickstart</artifactId>
+    <version>7.38.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+    <name>OptaPlanner Spring Boot school timetabling quick start</name>
+
+    <properties>
+        <version.org.optaplanner>7.38.0-SNAPSHOT</version.org.optaplanner>

replies.bodyText: Unless we for any reason use a different version for this project, let's use ${project.version} here. The less places to update the better.
replies.author: rsynek

replies.bodyText: The quickstart version will be 0.1.0-SNAPSHOT, and it won't have a parent pom, so we can't use ${project.version}..
replies.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText: Honestly, since it doesn't share our POM hierarchy, I wonder if it even belongs in this repo. It doesn't behave like all the other modules, so maybe it's not like the other modules.
replies.author: triceo

replies.bodyText:
Yea, the downside is if we push it it's own repo, we get cross-repo PR's (think git actions) and find-in-path searches that might not include it (because deverlopers won't know to add that repo in their IDE too)
I think this is the lesser evil.
replies.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText: Ah, and optaplanner-distribution would also need to move into it's own repo too: it depends on the quickstarts which depend on optaplanner starter/extension/core
replies.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: Is this caused by a frequent updates as a reaction on every new best solution available?
timeline.author: rsynek

replies.bodyText:
No, what happens if someone modifies a talk's teacher while it solving?
Well, the ProblemChangedRepositoryEventListener will probably prevent that, but not always.
The only safe way to prevent it is to use JPA optimistic locking (or worse, pessimistic locking). But this code won't work with optimistic locking... due to planning cloning. Definitly an issue many users will face.
replies.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText: out of scope to fix for this PR though
replies.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: I think it's worth describing what the issue is that a user needs to provide such a handler. This class is some kind of workaround. If I am required to put such a workaround in my project, I need to know why.
timeline.author: rsynek

replies.bodyText: Agreed, this needs a motivation
replies.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.message: optaplanner-quickstarts: first quarkus and spring boot quickstarts
optaplanner-quickstarts: first quarkus and spring boot quickstarts

timeline.bodyText: @ge0ffrey you can remove this line (27) - this is not any more used
timeline.author: mbiarnes
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+set -e
+
+initializeScriptDir() {
+    # Go to the script directory
+    cd `dirname $0`
+    # If the file itself is a symbolic link (ignoring parent directory links), then follow that link recursively
+    # Note that scriptDir=`pwd -P` does not do that and cannot cope with a link directly to the file
+    scriptFileBasename=`basename $0`
+    while [ -L "$scriptFileBasename" ] ; do
+        scriptFileBasename=`readlink $scriptFileBasename` # Follow the link
+        cd `dirname $scriptFileBasename`
+        scriptFileBasename=`basename $scriptFileBasename`
+    done
+    # Set script directory and remove other symbolic links (parent directory links)
+    scriptDir=`pwd -P`
+}
+
+initializeScriptDir
+
+if [ $# != 1 ] && [ $# != 2 ]; then
+    echo
+    echo "Usage:"
+    echo "  $0 newVersion releaseType"
+    echo "For example:"
+    echo "  $0 7.5.0.Final community"
+    echo "  $0 7.5.0.20171120-prod productized"
